repnme.cdata!:
China - First and Second Ertan
            Hydroelectric Projects, Sichuan Power Transmission Project,
            and Zhejiang Power Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings for the First and Second
            Ertan Hydroelectric Projects, Sichuan Power Transmission
            Project, and Zhejiang Power Development Project for China
            are as follows: For each of the four projects, the project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is high; Bank performance
            is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is satisfactory.
            The experience gained under the three projects reviewed in
            this report, as well as from the pursuit o f concurrent
            power sector reforms at the national level in China, offers
            these general lessons: 1) Power shortages are a barrier to
            the pursuit of market reforms aimed at increasing
            competition. 2)  Effective regulatory arrangements should be
            in place at the same time (if not sooner) as power supply
            entities are unbundled, in order to reduce abuses of market
            power. 3)  Indicative power system planning at the national
            level is essential in order to avoid boom-bust investment
            cycles such as the one currently building up in the Chinese
            power sector.

6073748.trustfund:
TF026652-PHRD-CHINA: IMPLEMENTATION OF
            THE ERTAN II HYDROELECTRIC PROJECT - INCO,TF020761-AUSTRALIAN CONSULTANTS TRUST
            FUND (USD),TF022150-PHRD 2-PRIVATIZATION PROGRAM
            I/CFS CONL'T

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and the institutional
            development impact substantial. Lessons reinforce the
            importance of following strict procurement guidelines, where
            joint ventures with insufficient technical, and financial
            capabilities should not be pre-qualified to bid. This factor
            was exemplified in the involvement of the offshore
            contractor, i.e., given its low capacity led to delays in
            mobilizing equipment. Conversely, international consultants
            fostered valuable inputs, such as design, construction
            methods, costs, and quality control. Furthermore,
            communication problems should be considered in designing
            procurement packages, since problems surfaced between
            Chinese, and foreign contractors/laborers, in terms of
            language misunderstandings, and cultural conflicts. This is
            conducive to a need for training methods that include the
            secondment of trainees for substantial periods during
            implementation, with modern management techniques, set at
            the early stages of the project. Although resettlement
            planning needs to be improved, China's institutional
            framework facilitates resettlement issues, due to: good
            policies, and incentives for resettlement as a development
            opportunity; significant planning managed by local
            authorities, through a participatory process, and, a
            resettlement funding, levied from project-generated income.

18225866.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
18225866.theme: Technology diffusion,Other financial and private sector development,Decentralization
18225866.trustfund:
TF026652-PHRD-CHINA: IMPLEMENTATION OF
            THE ERTAN II HYDROELECTRIC PROJECT - INCO

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Second Ertan
            Hydroelectric Project are to assist in: 1) the alleviation
            of acute power shortages in Sichuan in a least-cost manner
            through the completion of the Ertan Hydroelectric Scheme; 2)
            further institutional development of Ertan Hydropower
            Development Company (EHDC) as an autonomous, financialy
            sound and commercially-oriented entity; 3) promotion of
            competition through the development of market-oriented
            commercial arrangements for the sale of power generated
            under the project; 4) diversification of financing
            strategies for power development; and 5) transfer of modern
            technology for hydroelectric power plants. The project will
            cover continuing work on all of the components of the
            previous Ertan Hydroelectric Power Project and an expanded
            resettlement program for about another 5,000 persons. The
            project will also include technical assistance for policy
            support and project implementation support.

697193.trustfund:
TF026652-PHRD-CHINA: IMPLEMENTATION OF
            THE ERTAN II HYDROELECTRIC PROJECT - INCO

repnme.cdata!:
China - Ertan Hydroelectric Project :
            environmental assessment and resettlement

abstracts.cdata!:
Ertan Hydroelectric Project is located
            in Panzhihua Municipality on the lower reaches of the Yalong
            River in south-western Sichuan Province.  It is a
            comprehensive development with power generation as its
            primary objective.  It is planned to be the penultimate dam
            in a cascade of 11 dams along the Yalong River.  The
            information contained in this document addresses the
            environment, potential impacts and mitigation measures
            associated with the construction and operation of the Ertan
            dam and hydroelectric facilities.  The report also discusses
            the policy, legal, and administrative framework, the
            baseline conditions, the resettlement and social issues,
            and, finally, the environmental monitoring and training program.

docna.cdata!:
China - Ertan Hydroelectric Project :
            environmental assessment and resettlement

display_title.display_title:
China - Ertan Hydroelectric
            Project : environmental assessment and resettlement
